label: Physical description
value: Gouache over graphite, correction in white gouache Support: white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Emily Howland Chauncey
Cross-section of the domed central part of a palace

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A two-storied structure, showing the vaulted entranceway on the ground level and the Kaisersaal rising two stories, above, breaking the roof-line with a low dome on a high drum, pierced by windows. Scale given at sides. Ink framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, with gray and rose watercolors on paper

label: Description
value: Male figure with knee-length coat, holding round object in lifted right hand. Hair arranged in elongated shape on back of head. Square plinth, chipped. Figure made in two-piece mold.
Bateaux de sable à quai (Sand Barges Moored at the Quay), Arles

label: Description
value: Rhone River scene in Arles: Two boats loaded with sand are moored by a stone quay. A man with a loaded wheelbarrow is traversing a plank gangway from one of the boats to the quay, two figures are fishing at left middleground, and two sailboats float towards a bridge on the horizon in the upper right.

label: Physical description
value: Reed pen and brown ink, graphite on cream wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Ex-collection Mrs. J. van Gogh Bonger (sister-in-law of the artist), Amsterdam; Klas Fahraeus, Stockholm; Augustus T. Levinson, Copenhagen; Galerie d'Art Hugo Perls, Berlin; purchased from Perls by  Miss Edith Wetmore (The Frick Art Reference Library was informed by Mrs. Hall, Miss Wetmore's secretary [by telephone March 22, 1950], that Miss Wetmore purchased this drawing from the Hugo Perls Gallery.)

label: Notes
value: Rhone River scene in Arles: Two boats loaded with sand are moored by a stone quay. A man with a loaded wheelbarrow is traversing a plank gangway from one of the boats to the quay, two figures are fishing at left middleground, and two sailboats float towards a bridge on the horizon in the upper right.

label: Description
value:
Eight small panels painted with various Chinese scenes on a black ground.
A) Reedy branch with three pink flowers and buds, two brown birds.
B) Orchids and leaves in white, pink and green.
C) Pink and white flowering branch.
D) Red and white roses on branches.
E) Two white swallows of pink cherry blossoms
F) Arcs of pink bell shaped flowers.
G) Yellow flowers and brown and blue flower.
H) White flower and closed buds.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Miss Edna H. Bahr

label: Description
value: Triangular-shaped fragment with a white ground and a multi-colored design of roses and foliate. Along the upper edge is a border of dark blue with red dots. White silk threads, part of the construction, extend on two sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool and silk Technique: tapestry weave

label: Description
value: Fragment of black silk lace in the form of a flying eagle. Mounted on net.

label: Description
value: Fragment of black lace in the form of a jumping lion. Mounted on net.
Sheet of cartoons of contemporary life

label: Description
value: Eight vignettes, with accompanying text in German and French, showing several scenes with figures. Top register shows a scene with a seated woman; then a group of people sitting at a table; and a woman and man with a tailor measuring her dress. Below, register shows two women in profile; a woman drinking from a teacup; a man drinking from a glass; then the same man hunched over clutching his stomach. There is text throughout in black ink.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on glazed linen

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henriette B. Bonaventure
Les Précautions (The Precautions), from Le Monument du Costume

label: Description
value: A richly attired lady descends a stairway in profile and prepares to enter a sedan chair directly in front of her. A man in the center foreground faces her and reaches out for her hand. A few other elegantly dressed men are gathered around her. In the background the dome of the Church of the Assumption in the Rue Saint-Honoré, Paris can be seen.

label: Provenance
value: Henriette B. Bonaventure, Harrison, NY; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henriette B. Bonaventure

value: Brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on paper

label: Description
value: View in evening light across a river, with sailboats at the left. Low hills on opposite shore. Two thin trees, close together, in the immediate foreground
Hillside and Tree with Sailboats in Distance

label: Description
value: Two figures near a lone tree on a high bank in the foreground. Beyond, a body of water with two sailboats. Low, distant shoreline.

label: Description
value: Thirteen small scenes of boats and open landscapes, each framed.

label: Description
value: View of lower Manhattan from the Hudson in the evening mist.

label: Description
value: View across a sand bank, with tufts of grass. Buildings and sailing ship in the distance.

label: Description
value: A body of water, with gently rising bank at right. A tall, lone tree in the left foreground. Two ships in the distance.

label: Description
value: A smooth body of water with two boats in the foreground near a spit of land on which are tall trees.

label: Description
value: Low hills covered in snow and pairs of tall trees. Two sailboats in distance.
Nine Landscapes (Study of Forms in Space)

label: Description
value: Nine landscapes showing rolling hills, a few trees, and the setting sun.
Color Scheme for Temple Israel, Brooklyn, NY

label: Description
value: View of temple interior in a Byzantine style with indication of colored marbles and mosaic decoration of a large, vaulted, domed space.  Menorahs used as sculptural elements adorn the interior.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on paper

label: Description
value: Two landscapes with water, at twilight, showing reflections. Landscape with moonlight above, setting sun below.

label: Description
value: Leaf of a sketchbook. A single sailboat, left background.  In the foreground, figures near a farm cart.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Five studies of fields bordered by tall trees, and one of a body of water with two figures and a sailboat in the right foreground.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Six studies of heavily wooded landscapes. Lower left, an open quarry with figures and horse-drawn wagon. Lower right, a woodland stream.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, graphite on paper

value: An altar set in a shallow apse approached by steps; columns and pilasters set off the architecture.

value: Brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on paper
St. Peter, Study for Ceiling, Saint John the Baptist Church, Brooklyn, NY

label: Description
value: In circular format, half-length figure of St. Peter, seen in profile, holding two keys and a scroll.
Study for Rose Window for St. John the Baptist Church, Brooklyn, NY

label: Description
value: Circular medallions of four figures representing the earth, water, fire, and air. Other medallions with sunburst and geometrical flower forms. Medallion in center inscribed: JESUS

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on paper, laid down on illustration board
Study for Rose Window for St. John the Baptist Church, Brooklyn, NY

label: Description
value: Circular medallions with angels and stars. Central red medallion with "JESUS" in a heart.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on paper, laid down on illustration board

label: Description
value: Fragment of printed, glazed cotton with off-set ovals set on ornate capitals with scrolling acanthus leaves. Each oval contains a portrait: in the first column, three fashionable young women; in the center, a young couple, she smells a flower, he is in uniform and holds a ring between his thumb and index finger; in the third column, two women, one with her hand on the other's shoulder. The background is filled with delicate foliage. In blue-green and light brown on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller and block printed; glazed Label cotton printed by engraved roller and block printed, glazed

label: Description
value: A fisherman, accompanied by his wife and two small children, stands in an open boat, holding a long pole. A dog sits at the far right.

label: Physical description
value: Soft-ground etching in dark brown ink on cream wove paper

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle with irregular short sides. Basic block for multicolored design, cut for larger printing areas. Leafy swags (the stems and a few nails in brass), containing wreathed oval medallions with flower. At junction of swags, two crossed flutes in laurel wreath. Drop repeat, drop match. Block stamped "8596".

label: Credit line
value: Purchased in memory of Herman A. Elsberg
Drawing: Elevation of the window wall of the drawing room of the house of Herman Oelrichs, New York.

label: Description
value: An arched bay divides two arched windows, each surmounted by painted panels in rocaille frames, in the style of Germain Boffrand. Inscribed (in pencil), lower right: "Designed and executed by J.Gillow Garton." On verso: "A portion of design of entire salon for Mrs. Olerichs on north side of her home on 57th street., New York.  I employed special artists from Paris for decorative paintings on wall."

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and watercolors on two sheets of paper (joined)
Elevation of the door wall of a salon

label: Description
value: A double door, surmounted by a rocaille overdoor, is flanked by blank panels (probably intended to be covered in fabric) in rocaille frames, in the manner of Nicolas Pineau.  Part of ceiling cove shown.
Elevation of the chimney wall of a salon.

label: Description
value: A fireplace surmounted by a mirror in an elaborate rocaiile frame is flanked by painted panels also set in rocaille frames in the manner of Nicolas Pineau.  The dado includes circular panels.
Prospetto Interno del Teatro Olimpico Nella Citta di Vincenza (View of the Stage of the Teatro Olimpico at Vicenza)

label: Description
value: View of the mise-en-scene of the Teatro Olimpico at Vicenza, erected in 1579 by Andrea Palladio (1518-1580), and completed by Vincenzo Scamozzi (1552-1616).  Four sightseers are shown on the stage. Within the stage design, a barrel vault opening to a street with buildings. Niches along the stage wall contain statues of figures.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment

label: Description
value: Beside an Indian maiden, representing America, a patriot tramples British laws underfoot and extends the declarations of July 4, 1776, to Britannia, who weeps over a pedestal containing an urn, or a tomb.  The whole is contained within a curtained arch. Printed in black, white and gray on a light colorless ground.

label: Provenance
value: This paper was removed from the Jonathon Ingham house in Salem, New Jersey, built 1789.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. Ingham Evans

label: Description
value: Small reddish-brown cylinder in a high-relief of a simple running fret pattern which may represent snakes. Inside each of the frets is a head with two eyes, each one slightly different.

label: Dimensions
value: H x Diam: 2.4 x 2.3 cm (15/16 x 7/8 in.)
